doc.field: Series II: State and District Records
Series II: State and District Records
Communist Party of the United States of America Records
Communist Party of the United States of America Records

This subseries documents the activities of districts and states outside of New York. The bulk of these records derive from the 1960s and 1970s though there are a few materials from the first half of the 20th century. These records are not nearly as comprehensive as those of New York, presumably because each district did not systematically send records to the national office. The California and Illinois districts have the largest representation here, focusing mostly on Chicago and San Francisco. District convention materials and member correspondence files are noteworthy resources. The series includes select recordings of meetings from regional conventions and committees regarding official party policies and agendas.

A set of files from the Illinois state district were added to this subseries in 2018. They include committee reports, meeting minutes, budgets, election petitions, and publication from the 1980s. Meeting minutes and committee reports make up the bulk of these files, but other materials include ballot petitions and issues of campaign newsletters.
